summary: This bill, the Researching Efficient Federal Improvements for Necessary Energy Refining Act (REFINER Act), mandates the Secretary of Energy to instruct the National Petroleum Council to produce a report. The report will examine the role, contributions, capacity, and risks of petrochemical refineries in the United States, alongside the impact of federal and state actions. It will also provide recommendations to Congress and federal agencies for encouraging increased refinery capacity, emphasizing energy security and affordability of liquid fuels for consumers. The report must be submitted to the Secretary of Energy and Congress within 90 days of the bill's enactment and then made public.
